entry.title: DMEE XML File truncated after S/4HANA 2023 upgrade
entry.content:
Hi All,

We recently upgraded our system from S/4HANA 2021 to 2023.

We are noticing an issue with XML export in the FDTA transaction. When we try to download a new run, the generated XML file is truncated. Format DE_CGI_XML_CT.

For older runs (generated before the upgrade), the XML files are generated correctly also if we try to download it now.

Ca you help us, please?

Thank You

Best Regards

Alessandro

entry.title: Revoking of Withholding Tax Rounding Off Rule
entry.content:
Hi,

We have enabled the Rounding off rule for the Withholding Tax Type for all our Company Codes since April 2024.

Now, it has been decided to revoke this rounding-off rule for all company codes.

Kindly advise whether there will be any issue in revoking the rounding off rule in the middle of the financial year DIGITS-26, and its impact on entries that were posted already in earlier periods and the fiscal year.

entry.title: Budget is returned to available during the GR posting for PO's with acc assig ‚ÄúA‚Äù (Asset)
entry.content:
Dear Experts

We are Facing an issue when posting the Goods Receipt (GR) for purchase orders with account assignment type ‚ÄúA‚Äù (Asset). Upon posting via Movement Type 101, the system releases the committed and assigned budget back to availability. This behavior enables users to create additional purchase orders under the same WBS element using the same budget potentially without restriction.

The issue is that the system does not capture the WBS element already assigned to the asset during the GR posting. As a result, no CO document is generated, and the budget control mechanism fails to consume the allocated funds.

Notably:

  • Cost Element Category 90 is active.
  • The G/L Account linked to the relevant asset class has the ‚ÄúRecord Account Assignment‚Äù field enabled in Transaction Code FS00.
  • The account assignment objects in Asset Accounting are maintained via Transaction Code ACSET.

Despite these configurations, the system fails to derive the WBS element during the initial GR posting Movement Type 101

However, when the GR is reversed using Movement Type 102, the system correctly captures the WBS element, generates the corresponding CO document, and transfers the budget to the actuals with a negative value indicating that the integration logic functions correctly in reversal scenarios.

Thank you advance

Best Regard

entry.title: Reversed document from FB08 can be reverse again via FBRA
entry.content:
Problem : I reverse document 5080000001 via T-Code FB08, then systems auto post reversed document is 5100000001 and stamp 'Reverse with' value is 5100000001. And I can reset and reverse document 5100000001 via T-Code FBRA. After Execute, The reverse document 5100000001 was reverse by document 5100000002 that reversed document and 'Reverse with' in document 5080000001 was change from 5100000001 to blank.

Why? and Can I resolve this problem?

entry.title: KO88 doesn't settle down payment to ASSET UNDER CONSTRUCTION
entry.content:
When executing KO88, SAP does not consider the down payment. Instead, it settles the full PO invoice amount to the asset, without deducting the down payment as expected.

I have already verified in OKO7, and the down payment is correctly flagged there.

entry.title: OB52 restrict changes after certain days
entry.content:
Let me start by saying I don't think this is possible but thought I would ask the community.  The business wants to stop a user from being able open prior periods.  

For example: It is Aug 2025 which is period 5 2026 in SAP, can we have a lock that prevents saving a change to open period 4 2026 after the 15th business day of the month?

==============

I missed registering a leased asset for fiscal year 2024.
I registered the leased asset in April 2025.
As a result, the amount that should have been recorded for fiscal year 2024 was not recorded.
Therefore, I would like to record it retroactively.

Lease Period: December 1, 2024 - November 30, 2025
Lease Fee: MYR 27,238.58
AFAB is in effect until April 2025.

In addition to the above, I have learned that the lease fee will be reduced and the lease term will be extended.

Lease Period: July 1, 2025 - November 30, 2026
Lease Fee: MYR 27,184.73

What should I do in this case?
Please let me know if there is any missing information.

entry.title: Issue with Purchase Price Variance Posting in SAP ByDesign
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are experiencing an issue in SAP Business ByDesign related to product valuation during the procurement process.

Here‚Äôs the scenario:

  • In the product master data, under Valuation, we maintain a cost price of 1 Naira.
  • When creating a Purchase Order, we may buy the product at a different price (for example, 1,000 Naira per unit).
  • After posting the Goods Receipt, we noticed that the system splits the posting as follows:
    • Debit Material: 1.00 NGN
    • Credit Goods not yet Invoiced: 1000.00 NGN
    • Debit Difference in purchasing: 999.00 NGN

Our expectation is that the entire 1,000 Naira should be debited to the Material (inventory) account, not split between product valuation and purchase price difference.

Question:
How can we configure or treat this so that the full purchase price is capitalized in inventory, instead of posting most of it to the ‚Äúpurchase price difference‚Äù account?

Any guidance on the correct setup or configuration would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Depreciation showing successfull in AS02, but did not post!
entry.content:
Depreciation showing successfull in AS02, but did not post!

We did 2 changes on 2 assets which led to a newcalculation of the dep.run. When I wanted to run the depr. run, the changed assets were not within the run.

Now the changed assets have the mark "successfull depr. run", but they have not been depreciated (there is no accounting document!).

As we have to do Year-End-Close today, we have to have a sollution asap :-)....

Thanks and br,
